Reviews.Title: “Great sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very central location. First appearances of the hotel are lets just say a little bit underwhelming. The lobby and bar area are compact at the best of times but now are also somewhat overcrowded because of the restaurant makeover that is currently taking place. Once you are in the lift and heading to your room everything quickly improves. The rooms are a fantastic size infact enormous! They are decorated to a very high standard and have every possible amenity available. The staff are very friendly and helpful as well. Would I stay here again? Most definitely yes particularly as the restaurant would be reopened by then.

Reviews.Title: “"Guranteed" Early Check-in Not Honored”
Reviews.Author: Travelsthegl0be
Reviews.Content: I booked my room through the American Express Platinum-Fine Hotels and Resorts Program. One of the benefits is an alleged "guaranteed" noon check-in. After arriving off a red a long red-eye flight I was eager to take a nap in a comfy bed. Unfortunatley, this was not the case. After waiting in the lobby for over an hour and being lectured by the rude staff, I gave up and went to the Fairmont, where I was welcomed with warm hospitable service. Not the service or attitude one expects from a high-end hotel, I've had better experiences at an Econo Lodge. I probably won't (attempt to) stat at a Loews property again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the middle of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Chuck B
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here recently for several days. The rooms are spacious and very nice inside. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were excellent! The bathrooms are large and very clean. The staff could not have been better. They spoke English very well and were happy to guide some clueless americans around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed years ago but still top of my list!”
Reviews.Author: iluvrudy
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few nights 8 years ago , with my 2 cats and a big dog and I was treated so great. The service was impeccable! I still remember my stay all these years ( and hotel stays) later!

Reviews.Title: “It Doesn't Get Better”
Reviews.Author: antonioarch
Reviews.Content: Great service, a bathroom I got lost in and a bed that felt like sleeping on a cloud. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great city escape with kid at Vogue”
Reviews.Author: MissPixelsdotcom
Reviews.Content: I stay at Loews Vogue for my son birthday and we have a great stay! The staff was awesome. The hotel situation is perfect for a city espace! Its near everything, shopping, good restaurant, subway station... My son had a really great time!

Reviews.Title: “Loews Hotel Vogue Downtown Montreal Is Great”
Reviews.Author: Graham1366
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many different Downtown Montreal Hotels but by far the best has been Loews Hotel Vogue. The service is absolutely top notch. Good luck trying to beat the door man to opening the hotel doors. The front desk staff is very friendly and knowledgable. But I think the best of all is the rooms. They are fantastically appointed and the bathroom has a sepearate shower and soaker tub, with a TV and phone as well. When you arrive there is a nice welcome letter in the room and complementary water and fruit bowl, nice touch. I will be going back to this hotel ant time I get a chance to visit Montreal. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bedding”
Reviews.Author: mattsoleil
Reviews.Content: sealy palatial crest beds with very comfortable canadian down duvets and pillows. great service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: HappyPaddler
Reviews.Content: The Vogue is well located, extremely well appointed and the staff gives stellar service.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend away for two”
Reviews.Author: Seafoam01
Reviews.Content: Very comfy, loved the bath. if we stay again we'll ask for a room at the back of the building. We were on the 8th floor but noise outside made it sound like the first floor with the windows open. Just the same, friendly staff & nice weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Judd
Reviews.Content: As a native Montrealer, but now a long-time resident of Toronto, I still return to see friends and attend events. My favorite hotel for many years was the Ritz Carlton and I continued to stay there even after it began a long period of decline. (The totally rebuilt Ritz Carlton on a reduced scale will be back in operation soon.) In the scramble to find a new home-away-from-home, I have tried over recent years many alternatives, but the best I have found is the Loews Hotel Vogue. It's well-situated in "my" part of town, by that I mean in close proximity to Ste. Catherine Street (Montreal's main or high street), Sherbrooke Street (with its collection of art dealers, fine clothing shops, and museums, as well as McGill University and near-by Concordia University), and the multitude of shops and restaurants located on many of the side streets. It overlooks the former Jas. Ogilvy Department Store which in recent years has been home to a substantial collection of high-end boutique shops. (People wanting to be in the heart of "Old Montreal" will, however, find it a bit of a commute.) The hotel is small, which in my estimation adds to its appeal. The staff is abundant and very pleasant. The rooms I have been given have been very spacious, tastefully decorated and well-maintained. The bathrooms have also been very spacious with lots of marble and both a whirlpool bath and a shower. The lobby is small but with an attractive eating and drinking area. I believe this hotel will appeal to all sophisticated pleasure and business travellers who are seeking excellent accommodation in a very attractive and visitor-friendly part of Montreal. Visitors should probably request a room on a higher floor to have a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: JPKGTA
Reviews.Content: This small property has been a high-end staple of Montreal's downtown for quite some time. It is now a Loew's property, but because of its reputation and history, they've kept the "Hotel Vogue" name. The service staff go out of their way to remember your name and get to know what details you appreciate. The food is phenomenal, the property common areas are chic and sexy, and the rooms are very well appointed. The location can't be beat either. Definitely a go-to spot when I'm travelling in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: starfish08
Reviews.Content: A group of us just got back from a weekend trip to Montreal and my husband and I stayed at Hotel Vogue to celebrate my 40th. All of the staff that works here were amazing - they bent over backwords to help us out in any way they could. They even left a slice of cake and a birthday card in our room as a surprise. The rooms are very clean, the bed and pillows very comfortable and the bathroom is huge. Not sure if all the rooms have a jacuzzi tub but ours did and there was even a tv in there. Location is ideal and close to Old Montreal (5 minute cab ride). I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small story”
Reviews.Author: JimWiggins
Reviews.Content: I ordered room service about 8 PM on Tuesday, Feb 7, asked for mustard & A-1 sauce for a cheeseburger. Signed check, gave nice but not exorbitant tip. Mentioned A-1 didn't make it, but didn't express any particular dissatisfaction or disappointment. Waiter, an older man, said they didn't have it, that he'd check again & bring it if he could find any. A moment later he knocked, said they didn't have any & offered something else. I was pleasantly very shocked he actually came back. Had paid him before all this had taken place and didn't really imagine he'd trek to the kitchen & back to my 5th floor room just to confirm what he'd said & offer another option. Very nice thing. So the location of the hotel I found to be ideal, the room very nice, service uniformly friendly, but this little episode was what really impressed me.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: FineTravellerNewYork
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times. It is not a large hotel, more like a boutique. But it is not small either. Just right. The rooms are large with a big bathroom and most have whirlpool baths. The staff is outstanding. It is right in the center of town, easy walking to just about anywhere. I have been at other good hotels in Montreal, but this is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: DrFady
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms are big Service is great. Lobby bar s nice for a drink before going out. Lots of shopping and restaurant in the area

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Grandpa_Walton
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel if you want to stay in downtown MontrÃ©al(very well located for the downtown core etc.). I booked a premium king room via the Loews(beginning of January 2012) website and everything was as requested. The Loews Hotel Vogue is a premium hotel that is very well maintained, the public areas are clean and as-well the rooms. The rooms are very well appointed with nice furnishing and amenities. The decor/furnishings are very nice but a bit dated and worn. I think the rooms and the hotel are due for a mini-facelift, just to fresh things up.... This remains to be very nice and good hotel. There are two things that bothered me during my stay: 1) I couldn't find a mail box to mail two letters outside nor inside the hotel and I asked the front desk clerk to put them in his outgoing mail. This seemed to be a tedious task for him. 2) Had room service for breakfast and I was disappointed with the quality of the food for a premium hotel and price. For example I ordered eggs Benedict and the hollandaise sauce seemed to outsourced or packaged(powder). Overall this a very nice and excellent located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: green100
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay over new year's to attend a wedding. Staff are very helpful, curteous, and efficient. The room was well appointed and had everything you could need including a phone and television in the bathroom. We had the continental breakfast included in our stay...apparently it is a $50 breakfast for 2. I would not pay that for the breakfast, but it was nice that it was delivered to the room. it is a pricier hotel, but I would say certainly worth the price for the service that is provided. Only thing negative I could say about the room is that the shower stall tiling and shower head leave something to be desired compared to the rest of the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Business or Personal”
Reviews.Author: BellaMorganHill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while on business. It was an absolutely lovely hotel and I would not hesitate to come back here again for either business or pleasure. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel. (Found a great little Tapas place around the block that was called "Cartel", I believe.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BStatham
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Hotel. Nice property in a Great Location to Downtown Business's, The Bell Centre Restaurants Shopping etc...The rooms are a bit dated but clean and good customer service at the front Desk and Bar.Valet service was Fast and Friendly. After staying in the W and others in Montreal this is still a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good service”
Reviews.Author: NAFTAflyer
Reviews.Content: Location is great but the service makes this place shine. Helpful staff with good recommendations. Rooms are a bit dated but clean and well kept. Huge bathrooms with amenities and jacuzzi's. Internet works well. Free Loew's youfirst membership makes the internet free. This is a no-hassle good place to stay. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: shanenolan2
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quaint but modern hotel where you can just "park the car" and explore than this is it. The hotel is situated between two major shopping streets in Montreal with Sherbrooke Street housing the higher end shops and St Catherine St with its more moderate shops. It's is within walking distance to the museums and the very safe and effecient underground Metro system. The hotel by the way, is located right across the street from one of Montreal's iconic and oldest department stores Oglivy's where they still play the bagpipes to open and close the store. We stayed in an executive suite that gave us a good sized living room , kitchenette, full dining room and a lovely fireplace. Note that this suite also comes with the additional bathroom and shower besides the very large full bath off the bedroom. My only negative was the fact that the living room suite area did not have any windows. That area is very well lit but I still like natural light in the room. The room service is excellent and the staff lovely. They offer in and out privileges on the daily overnight parking (C$32) rate. By the way, the valet staff is quite quick in retrieving the cars when you ask for it. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: Great time in Montreal and a superb location. You can walk anywhere or take the metro from this hotel. Parking is a little steep but you are in the city. Become a you first Loewe member for free internet access in the room. $14.95 per day for Internet in the room is not worth it. The staff was very friendly. Exchange your U.S$ at an exchange store for a great rate, hotel exchange is a rip off. The room was beautiful and my wife and plan to stay at a Loews property whenever we can.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast to remember!”
Reviews.Author: KatRossaNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel few years ago with my husband. The room was medium sized, elegant with a wonderful poster bed. It felt very luxurious! The bathroom was exceptional with marble tiles, jacuzzi and flat screen tv by the tab :) Nice touch :) What we loved the most was the breakfast that was rolled in to our room in the morning that consisted of coffee, juice, delicious pastries and croissants and jams.. Yum! Another nice touch were bottles of water and apples left for us each day in the car as valet pulled it in front of the hotel. It was an amazing stay and I would definitely go back to Lowes Hotel Vogue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daytripp-r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Vogue this past weekend, and again it was a very nice experience. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are clean and very quiet. Even though we stayed in a room right next to the elevator we heard nothing. Very nice. The restaurant is undergoing a renovation, so we did not eat in the hotel this trip. There was food service available in the very nice lobby bar, but with a huge selection of great restaurants just around the next corner we were able to eat very well for the weekend. The Vogue is directly across the street from the upscale retailer Ogilvies in Montreal and Sainte Catherine street is a 2 minute walk... and of course the Bell Centre is three blocks away if you are in town for a concert or Hockey game. I can't think of a better place to stay when visiting Montreal for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Fraser1972
Reviews.Content: Great room and very good service. Nicely located in Montreal. We've stayed there the last 3 or 4 times we were in Montreal and will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and elegant”
Reviews.Author: CFMM59
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights here. From the moment the taxi deposited us at the door to our departure, we enjoyed 5 star treatment. The room was comfortable and well lit (a particular bug bear) with accessible sockets for charging laptops and phones. The bathroom was stunningly decorated and for someone who normally disdains the tv, it was alarming how much I enjoyed lying in the bath watching the news. The restaurant was being refurbished when we were there so breakfast was served in the bar. In the evenings the bar was like Francine, the bartender's, own front room and we felt very welcomed. The hotel is in Downtown and we there as tourists so it was quite a walk to Vieux Montreal. It is incredibly convenient for the attractions of Rue Ste Catherine and Ogilvy's department store.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Pet-Friendly Hotel Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: David_and_Lauren
Reviews.Content: This trip to Montreal was last minute to see a hockey game at the Bell Centre and this hotel made the trip relaxing and easy. It is an elegant hotel with a marble lobby and located in the best part of Montreal directly across from Ogilvy by St. Catherines. The valet parking was smooth and easy. For anyone that has travelled with a bet, you know that it can be tricky. Upon checkin, the front desk gave us a pet welcome kit with dog food, treats, and toys. The room was already set up with a dog bed and bowls, and the concierge made all arrangements to have a professional pet sitting service come to our room and take care of the pooch while we went out to the Bell Centre (a short 5-minute walk). The service charged $15/hr. The hotel charged $25 for having a pet...this was a one-time fee. The room itself was beautiful (we had a premium king) and spacious with a marble jacuzzi and private flat screen apart from the tv in the living room. Overall, cannot think of a single downside to this hotel. It is the way all hotels should be.

Reviews.Title: “5 visits and counting”
Reviews.Author: casdobbin
Reviews.Content: If you want to be near all the action in downtown Montreal, Loews is the place to be. Just a few steps from Crescent and St. Catherine Streets there's no end to the shopping and dining in the area. I've stayed here every time I've been to Montreal and the service has been great. The rooms are top notch, I'd almost stay in the bathroom it is so nice. Normally there's a deal of some sorts where you get a bar and beverage credit, or discount for staying a certain number of nights. My last trip there was in June and I can't wait for the next one.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best downtown”
Reviews.Author: commodoredavem
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several downtown hotels in Montreal, and this is one of the best (and much better than Le Montagne across the street where we stayed last time). The service, decor and quality of room was excellent. We got the premium king ($210 p/n) and we had a very large room with a seating area, a desk, and a lovely, big bathroom with hot tub and separate walk in shower. The location is superb for walking everywhere and enjoying the city's vibrant downtown shops, bars and restaurants. Several very good restaurants are nearby, as well as some good brassieries and pubs (we ate at Thursdays). There are also several good places for breatkfast nearby, including "M" at the corner of Montagne and De Maisoneuve. Very good hotel security -- you must use your room key to access the elevators. And once you have stayed twice with the Loews chain, you get free inroom internet (otherwise only free in the lobby). The only downside is that this part of downtown can be noisy at night and in the early morning, so try to get a room on the back side of the hotel. Also, valet parking is a bit pricey at $32 a night, but it is indoors. The alternative is to parking a few doors down in the outdoor lot -- cheaper but less secure, especially on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, but...”
Reviews.Author: Abbyreh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, in the heart of Montreal's downtown. Easy to get to shopping, restaurants and arts. Great staff that treat you like royalty. Lovely rooms, BUT..noisy. Ask for a room in the back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: travelling_Doodle
Reviews.Content: Attended Montreal with the whole family, and this time the dog too, to checkout McGill University and the Leafs at the Bell Centre. A great weekend was had by all. The hotel's location was very convenient for walking around campus, downtown, shopping district and walking to the game. Loews allows pets, and at $25 additional charge for the dog, it was a cheaper option than a dog sitter. Unlike some hotel chains, we were not required to hire a dog sitter at some outrageous price if we chose to leave the dog alone in the room. The hotel staff was very nice to everyone. The two connecting rooms are large and very well appointed. The hotel charges for parking, wi-fi (in the room) and other annoyances but because my wife is a CAA member a voucher of $50/room was given and this covered all of these incidentals. The lounge/breakfast area is small but there are two great breakfast restaurants directly across the street. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Still one of the best in town”
Reviews.Author: julesBocaRaton_Fl
Reviews.Content: Great location and staff make this the best hotel in Montreal. Small enough so that the doormen and valets all know your name yet not ridiculously expensive (or pretentious) as the St. James.

Reviews.Title: “high quality personal attention...........”
Reviews.Author: glennieLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: As others have said, nothing beats the Loews personal attention. We live in Los Angeles, and have spent many wonderful vacation days at the Loews in San Diego, Coronado Island. They treat our 3 doggies with affection, and provide truly wonderful customer service whenever we are lucky enough to spend a few days there. That's why when I knew we were going to end our vacation cruise in Montreal, this was the only hotel I considered for a few extra days before flying home, even without the dogs. I corresponded with one of the Concierge's, Caro, months before - asking for restaurant and sightseeing recommendations, and she was most helpful. I mentioned our affection for the Loews Coronado, and sent her a couple of photos of our family with the 3 doggies. What did we find when we checked into our lovely, upgraded room when we arrived? My photos had been printed out from the email, and framed, placed on our room vanity table with a note from Caro, welcoming us. Now that is above and beyond the duties of a concierge!!!!!!!!!! They were so accommodating and helpful in every way - from the doormen and bellmen, to the front desk and room service waiters. The location is great. We found a terrific French restaurant just a block away, recommended by the concierge. Finally, when we checked in, the General Manager, Natalie, personally greeted us. Where else does that happen!

Reviews.Title: “PURE EXCELLENCE”
Reviews.Author: HLGA
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, check in, concierge, rooms,very early check out time, a pure pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: CanadaOdie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip because I had meetings in their conference rooms the next morning. The room was huge and very nice. The bathroom was very large too and had a large corner whirlpool tub with a separate shower. There was a separate vanity/makeup area. They seemed to have thought of many little details to make things as comfortable as possible. On the downside - recognize that this is not a cheap hotel... breakfasts were in the range of $25 for 2 eggs, bacon, and toast. Two toasts were $8. There are no vending machines and the mini-bar/snack-bar prices are - well the normally outrageous snack bar prices. Internet access is $14-something per day. In this day and age (and at this price range), I would have expected internet to be included.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Choice in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: BrianRI
Reviews.Content: Although the exterior of the Vogue is unimpressive, the spacious rooms, nicely-appointed interior and friendly staff make for an excellent experience. We stayed in a suite for two nights at the Vogue and were very pleased. The rooms were very nice. Good sized with large, modern bathrooms. All the of the staff was very helpful. The restaurant is under renovation, but breakfast and room service were still available. Very close to shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay at Hotel Vogue”
Reviews.Author: dsarah
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there at least 4 times over the past 10 years and keep coming back. Other reviews and pictures say it all. Its a small boutique hotel on a city street with class and extremely friendly service. View from the room was not great but who cares when the room is so spacious, beautiful and well laid out. Bathroom is to die for and an extra counter with makeup mirror in the entry area makes it perfect. The rate was very reasonable considering we had paid much more per night at other hotels in the New England states during this trip. The only downside was $33/night for valet parking and their restaurant was closed during our visit (Sept. 2011). They did serve breakfast and dinner items in their bar area but it seemed a bit disorganized and service was slow. Other than that we had a great stay at Hotel Vogue and I'm sure we'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ph7719
Reviews.Content: After two stays at Hotel Vogue I have no complaints. The staff is consistently friendly and helpful, the rooms are kept clean, the bathrooms are spacious and the location is great. Complimentary wi-fi is also a plus. I would definitely return again as the value for price paid is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bobie
Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean ,comfortable,and an excellent location just around the corner from St.Catherine. Huge bathroom with tv and jacuzzi. Lovely make up table just outside the washroom with an extra hair dryer.Perfect when you are four females sharing the room. Only complaint would be that there wasn't much selection on the tv and we had no view. Would defenitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive service, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: McGillparent
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Queen Elizabeth before, but couldn't get in this trip, so booked into Loews. Now I may not go back! We pulled over and the bellman instantly approached our vehicle and seemed to know our names. He directed us to the public parking lot next door, which was much less expensive than valet parking (not an option for us in any event, as we had a roof box on top).Other staff were equally friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and spotless and surprisingly quiet for the downtown location. A block from Crescent Street, where you can find great restaurants that permit you to bring your own wine; makes a good dinner much more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable low key luxury.”
Reviews.Author: icybeta
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, low key chain hotel. The room was better than I expected. Location isn't the best, but convenient enough to the parts of downtown that I visited.

Reviews.Title: “Personalized service”
Reviews.Author: MimiDot
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the Labour Day weekend. We were very well treated by all the employees who went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. The room was a good size with a large bathroom which included a Jacuzzi. The hotel is close to Ste-Catherine St., metro, restaurants, museums and nightlife and also the train station and Bell Centre. Excellent service at the Opera resto/bar near the lobby entrance where we also had a yummy breakfast. Used the free internet service in the lobby. All-in-all we were impressed with the employees and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: handmsmom
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful and well cared for. The staff was attentive to us always. I don't think I ever opened the door myself! The room was pretty and the bathroom was to die for! The bar was small, but bartender friendly. There are so many great places to eat around the area, so we never went to the restaurant. I'm not even sure if it was open. The only issue we had was that we assumed that the mini bar fridge would keep our leftovers cold, but it didn't and we lost some pretty good doggy bags! The front desk told us that the fridge doesn't have a compressor, so doesn't get cold. I wish we were told that upon checkin. We were there for 4 days and we kept messing with the dial thinking we just had to turn it up, but... When we said something to the front desk, they brought up a refrigerator within 10 minutes and were very apologetic. So, as long as you are aware not to rely on the mini fridge, everything else at this hotel is top notch. Great shopping and restaurants in the area. we had a great time in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: tigerhawke
Reviews.Content: A solo trip, upgraded to a suite, beautiful room! Perfect from the welcome gift of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries to the large luxurious rooms and bedroom and a bathtub to die for! Centrally located, with great shopping and nightlife all close by. This was not my first time staying at the Vogue and will not be my last!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to make basecamp”
Reviews.Author: happyfatty
Reviews.Content: Staff was great and plentiful. Rooms a little dated but plenty nice and clean. Resteraunt is closed for renno's (looks long term). So many great resteraunts, pubs and shopping in walking distance. Good place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “Tres Belle”
Reviews.Author: leslie06
Reviews.Content: Thank you Trip Advisor contributors for the great information on this hotel. We selected it based on this feedback and you were right. It is a wonderful, beautiful hotel in a fun, lively part of Montreal. The hotel is gorgeous; we went for our 25th wedding anniversary and a bottle of sparking wine was in our room upon arrival. The room was huge--I thought they had upgraded us, but no, this was the standard room. Great location, plenty of restaurants and if you enjoy walking, it is not that far to walk to old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eagle7345
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Loews Montreal for 4 nights and were bowled over. This is a true 5 star hotel with top class facilities. Our room was a deluxe room with the biggest bathroom we have ever come across. House keeping and reception were both excellent. It is not surprising this hotel is rated so highly on Tripadvisor. I would not hesitate to recommend staying here when visiting Montreal. There are many excellent restaurants and cafes locally providing great food.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: STEVE272727
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent this past weekend in beautiful Montreal. What made our trip that much more special was this fantastic hotel which we stayed at. From the doorman, to the front desk check-in, to the concierge, the service was excellent. Throughout our stay we were literally treated like royalty. The oversized room and washroom were tastefully decorated and absolutely spotless. The bed was incredibly comfortable. If this hotel is not ranked #1 in Montreal, it's a crime. We have stayed at some of the finest hotels, and this one stands out among them all. We could rave on and on about this superb hotel experience, but we assure you that you will not be disapppointed in any way. You should also be aware that the location too is fabulous. One block from the famous Crescent Street, and only a half block from the retail stores on St. Catherines Street. On a final note: My hats off to the General Manger of this hotel for all her hospitality as well as that of her support staff. How often does a senior manager greet their hotel guests first thing in the morning in the main lobby? Thank you Nathalie Lalonde for a truly memorable two days at your fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big comfortable rooms, incredibly friendly staff"”
Reviews.Author: kfl56
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a wonderful location - right near McGill Univ, museums, the shopping on St Catherine Street, and the restaurants and bars on Crescent Street. We are walkers, and had no trouble walking to Vieux Montreal as well as up to the Mont Royal area. The hotel is easily accessible by Metro as well. Our room was very large and very comfortable - the bathroom was also very large and beautiful, with nice large and heavy towels, and terry lined robes. While we did not take anything from the minibar, we did use the little fridge for some of our own things like water, apples, etc with no issue. There is a Keurig coffee maker in the room, with unlimited coffee pods, creamers, and sweetners, which I loved! I could have my coffee in the morning and another one later in the day if I wanted. The curtains enabled us to make the room very dark at night, which I appreciate. The lobby is very tastefully decorated and there is always a bowl of fruit and later something cold to drink. Since I did not want to pay the fee for internet in my room, I used the lobby computers frequently with no hassle at all. I never had to wait and no-one ever was waiting for me to get off. We both used the fitness center and enjoyed the fact that they have a supply of earphones to use on the tv each machine has, free bottled water, apples, and towels. Probably the best part of this hotel is the personalized service we received. From the moment we pulled up, the staff greeted us warmly and graciously. Each time we came in and out of the hotel, they addressed us by name and we chatted with them about how our day went, where we were going to eat, etc. It truly was a lovely and homey touch to an elegant hotel. My only complaint is that every morning at about 6:00 am we heard trucks (maybe garbage trucks) for about 5 minutes or so, and then it would get quiet again. We were facing the back of the hotel and I don't know if it would be quieter facing the street in the front. It is almost impossible for a city hotel to block all street noises, so I am not sure this would be better anywhere else. Otherwise, we found our room to be very quiet. The restaurant was closed, but they were providing a limited breakfast menu in the bar area. We saw it was very expensive and found 2 excellent restaurants a block away to enjoy breakfast - one of which was the notable Eggspectation. I loved this hotel and would definitely come back if ever in Montreal again. BTW - we have AAA and got a nice discount.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveler22
Reviews.Content: We chose the Loews based on traveller reviews, particularly due to the fact we were travelling with our dog. ready for this?..Loews really loves pets. Staff treated our dog as movie stars. We also hired the services of a pet sitter who took care of our baby for few hours while we went to dine out. The only thing the hotel doesn't have is a swimming pool, but within the scheme of things, that is minimal. Location is perfect, particularly since this was the first time in Montreal. Subway stops (Peel Station) is only couple of blocks from the hotel. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. If you ar etravelling with your pet, look for restaurants with patios, they will let you sit outside with your dog. The concierge was very knoweldge and friendly. Overall, we highly recommned this hotel. It is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Loews Hotel Vogue a tremendous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cgras777
Reviews.Content: The most courteous and helpful staff - especially Michel and Michael - very clean and great amenities - Jacuzzi in the room. Free wi-fi and internet access in the lobby. Cozy and comfortable beds - we stayed with our 10-year-old daughter and she had a blast! My only comment is about the pool - although there is one to use , it is not in the hotel, but in the next building.

Reviews.Title: “solid, clean, good location, well-run”
Reviews.Author: redryderent
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent - both attentive and prompt - and friendly. Upon registering, at 1AM, I was given the option to park in adjacent open-air non-hotel lot for $20/day, versus $32/day hotel valet. Love that honesty! Room was nearly sparkling. Bathroom was luxurious. TV was okay - all analog channels, mostly in French ;-> Paid CDN $159/night via Montreal Canadiens rate, which was reasonable given the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Straight from 'Beverly Hills Chihuahua'!”
Reviews.Author: baddogsboy
Reviews.Content: This chose this hotel because it was a pet friendly hotel and we travelled this with our pug and our chihuahua-pug cross. Well we got the royal treatment. A bag of treats, a ball and bandanas were given to us at the reception when we checked in. Also a little card from the hotel staff welcoming our dogs (by their name!) and saying that if we needed anything for then to give them a call, which we did. Whoever visits Montreal knows it's an amazing place for shopping. Since the dogs cannot stay by themselves in the room (it is part of the rules and we knew about that prior anyways) we asked if we could have a dogsitter for the day after and there was no problem at all! Yes it was a charge of 15 dollars an hour, but it was totally worth it. We ended up at Simons and the Montreal Eaton Centre (which is a mere 10 minutes walk). The bathroom was all marble with a TV to watch while taking a bath. The room itself was really spacious. And... there was also a dog bed specially the dogs, some spring water for them, and bowls. We felt completely spoiled and straight from the Beverly Hills Chihuahua movie! There was even a room service menu for pooches (but we didn't try). The hotel is a bit on the pricey side, and there is an extra $25.00 for deep cleaning per stay extra when dogs are with you, but it was actually worth every penny. From the reservation desk to check-out, everyone was so nice!

Reviews.Title: “There are much better values in the area.”
Reviews.Author: KipF
Reviews.Content: This Loews is a disappointment, especially when compared to other Loews hotels. It is not on a par with other Loews hotels - more like a Sheraton. The location is good, but there are nicer hotels for less money in the area. The restaurant was closed for renovations. It would have been nice if we were informed of that prior to our arrival. Hotel staff could use a refresher on Loews "You First" program.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel amazing service! 4 1/2 stars!”
Reviews.Author: campo84748
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Our room did however smell of ciggerette smoke when we checked in. Room had a nice 32" flat screen tv and the bed was ultra comfy. The service there was outstanding. 24 hour room service was classy like the rest of the hotel.. If your going to spend 300$ a night on a room it may as well be here and not the hyatt thats for sure. We spend 3 nights here and one of the nights the band Weezer checked in since they were playing in the area. Of course 30 something a day for parking and another 15$ a day for wifi is not cool, but what can you do. The people at the front desk and the concierge were fantastic. Oh and yes, the bathrooms are to die for!!! Love that tub. Will make you want to spend more time in the room and then you will miss all that montreal has to offer. Next time though i will stay closer to the old montreal area.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Illin0isTravelers
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel in downtown Montreal, the Vogue is a good option. On a quiet street, good location. Very helpful staff, assisted with things to do and places to eat. Would definitely recommend the Vogue.

Reviews.Title: “Great posh business hotel”
Reviews.Author: wnose72
Reviews.Content: Was here on business - GREAT location, not far from Crescent Ave (party!). Elegant property and spotless all around. Very helpful staff and great amenities too!!!! Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: 55flower
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel in a great location. The room was lovely, bathroom extraordinary, breakfast fantastic! The staff is really knowledgeable and helpful. We loved our stay in the hotel with a great rate that included breakfast! Wish every hotel was like this!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel situated in the very central of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Henry1999_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good. We got this from PRICELINE.COM and we enjoyed the stay at Loews.But I was a little disappointed that the wi-fi isn't free. They charge you 14.95 per night and another thing is the breakfast is closed so we have to find breakfast by myself. Reception staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel right in the city centre. I had a great stay. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this wonderful property, with excellent service both times. We were a party of six; two adults, our teenage daughters, and two of their friends. As such, we had booked an executive suite (1100 sq ft, master bedroom plus kitchen, dining table for 8 and living room) with a connecting room with two queen beds (450 sq ft). The concierge was extremely helpful via email with pre-trip planning, and even arranged to have the kitchen stocked with groceries from a local supermarket that delivered, as well as extra kitchenware. Upon arrival after midnight, a friendly young man at reception checked us in. Upon arrival at the rooms, we were greeted with numerous complimentary amenities (as a Loews Platinum member), however we were very surprised at the layout; the connecting room did not connect to the suite living room, but rather to the other side of the master bedroom, so people in the 2 bedded room would have to go through the master bedroom to get to the suite living room or kitchen! I went down to the reception desk and explained why this would not work with unrelated teens in our party, and he was very understanding and explained that the connecting room on the other side of the suite had only a King bed, however without batting an eye, he explained that he could resolve the situation by adding an additional connecting room at no extra charge, so we ended up with a 2000 sq ft three bedroom suite at no additional cost. Needless to say, we were very impressed that he was empowered to resolve our situation so quickly without needing to get approval from a manager, etc. This level of service continued throughout our stay, and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dray_7
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Loews Hotel Vogue in Montreal for a mid-winter getaway. The hotel is a charming, boutique style facility in a perfect location. Despite very cold weather, we were able to walk easily (one block) to St. Catherine's Street and to local and excellent restaurants. Our room was very spacious with an extremely comfy bed (my 6 foot 3 inch hubby said he'd never had such a good night sleep in a hotel!) - the bathroom was very large and everything was immaculately clean. Although we had been promised a room with a nice view, we unfortunately overlooked the street and some rooftop airconditioning units. Nevertheless, the hotel was superb. Particularly noteworthy - fabulous concierge service - helpful, accomodating and friendly - really making our stay so nice. There was a lovely fireplace with seating area in the main lobby (hot chocolate and marshmellows served each day!) and a very clean and well equipped fitness centre on the top floor. There was also free computer access (two computers) in a small area on the main floor which we were able to access easily. If there is one downside to this hotel, it is that there is no restaurant on site. We were told many different 'versions' as to 'why' this is the case: "the previous restaurant did not renew its lease" "the restaurant is being renovated" "the hotel is taking it over in April" (also told November) - whatever the reason, the hotel has converted the bar area to a small breakfast site. We had breakfast there the first morning and while the food was excellent, the table tops were no bigger than a large tapas plate and we almost spilled our coffee over everything - very 'wonky' and uncomfortable. There is room service but very very expensive as is the mini bar in the room. Despite this shortcoming, we would still rate this hotel five stars. There are many excellent restaurants within a two minute walk and the hotel itself is very very clean, spacious and welcoming. These factors were more important to us than the lack of a restaurant. We would definitely stay at the Loews again and I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in centre of downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: monie14
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to visit Mcgill University and spent two nights at Hotel Vogue. This charming boutique hotel is on a lovely street right near St. Catherine's St. in downtown Montreal with shops, restaurants etc. all within easy walking distance. The staff were very friendly and the Concierge was extremely helpful with booking our train tickets as well as offering choices for bistros nearby and tips on sightseeing. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the bathroon was nicer than we expected. There is a cute spot for breakfast near the lobby but no real restaurant. It was a great place to stay to visit Mcgill, shop and meet friends. I would definitely stay there on my next trip to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Now This Is A "Downtown" Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TourGuide4familyof4
Reviews.Content: I travel to Montreal on Business 2-3 times a year and on my last visit stayed at the Hotel De La Montagne (across the street from the Vogue). I decided to try out the Lowe's on this trip as I had seen it on my last visit and thought it looked nice. I typically stay just off St. Catherine and have probably tried out 20 of the various hotels over the course of my trips to Montreal but the Lowe's Hotel Vogue might be the very best of them all. It's right in the heart of everything, around the block from Crescent Street and a hop skip and a jump from the Bell Centre. The lobby area is clean and well kept and the elevators which lead to the rooms upstairs only work if you slide your room key (an added touch for security). The front desk personnel were great and always very friendly & helpful. The hotel was under renovation (although you would never know it) and the Cellini Restaurant was closed. We also heard that some of the hotel rooms were under renovation and found out that we were in the older wing. I have to say if the room we stayed in was the older wing I can only imagine what the new wing must be like. The rooms were well kept, with a large bathroom seperate shower & nice jacuzzi tub. The hotel even had a nice aroma of fresh flowers which reminded me of the hotels in Hawaii. I think I may have to make this my hotel of choice on all my future visits to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeNewYork
Reviews.Content: First time to Montreal with my mother for a weekend of sightseeing, shopping and eating. Couldn't have been more pleased - on arrival, concierge had left an envelope with details of reservations I had called about. Front desk, doorman, all services so courteous and warm. The female bartender is terrific - saw mention of her previously. Second night into bar she offered the same cognac I had the night before - impressive! Had dinner at Cellini, so good I will make a point of eating here again next stay. The room was perfect, the Jacuzzi tub (especially after walking all day) and TV in the bath was a big plus for me. Bed perfectly comfortable - will definitely be back, and soon, I hope.

Reviews.Title: “good choice in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: thefoureyedpanda
Reviews.Content: The Vogue is well located, across from Ogilvy (the nicest department store in the city in my opinion) which also means very close to Ste. Catherine, Sherbrooke and Crescent Streets. I stayed in a very spacious executive suite with bathtub, two TVs (better choice of channels should be available), very comfortable bed, nice bathrooms. Shower pressure was good but shower itself a bit old fashioned even if well maintained. Service a bit uneven but in general very good. Good room service but a bit expensive. Bar at the lobby looks dated. I have to say that overall it does not feel like a 5 star hotel but still quite good. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great again if not for "tired" furnishings!”
Reviews.Author: SwedishAmerPrincess
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Vogue at least 7 times in the last few years. The service, always impeccable; the decor and style of the hotel, fabulous; the Opera Bar, and especially the female bartender at the Bar, wonderful! But, the furnishings are getting a little tired in the rooms (replaced the silk drapes on the four poster bed with cheap netting; peeling paint/finish on the entertainment center and the other furniture). Not up to their prior outsatnding quality. Loews must be cutting costs! In addition, on the last night of our stay there was a snow storm. We were awakened from our sound sleep (9th floor) at 2:00 a.m. by a private snow plow, plowing out the parking lot, backing up (beep ...beep... beep sound) every minute for over two (2) hours. Sounded like a wakeup alarm on a clock radio. Very, very annoying. I suggest that they disable the plow's beeping back-up feature.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff; no downstairs ambiance to speak of, but modern and quiet rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Biz-FunTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vogue is well located in the heart of the shopping district of Montreal. Traveling there alone, I felt safe walking to dinner and around the immediate area. The staff were courteous and helpful, and the room service was great. There isn't much of a grand entrance or lobby, which takes away from the ambiance a bit, but everything has a clean and elegant look overall. The restaurant is pricey but service and food are good. The rooms are very nicely appointed -- large, comfy beds, updated furniture, beautiful huge bathroom. Minor complaint was that the TV in the bathroom went on the blink, but I wasn't super-interested in using it. The windows were large and let in lots of light. My room had a pretty boring back-alley view, but it was quiet! If you are here on business and going to the Palais des Congres (convention center), it's about a 10-minute walk to the metro and a couple subway stops straight there, or a 5-10 minute cab ride. Note, the Lucien L'Allier metro stop seemed fine in the daytime but a bit sketchy at night. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location but could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust40
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel partly because of the many rave reviews and while I can say that the location was great and the staff very friendly and helpful, I was a bit disappointed with the hotel itself. It is definitely a little worn and the decor could use some updating. The carpet in my room was very worn, the furniture scuffed, and the overall feel was out of date. Sorry to say I would choose another hotel nearby (e.g. Hotel Le Crystal) should I return to Montreal. That said, just a few fixes would make it first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Never treated any better anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: BruceHToronto
Reviews.Content: Great location and a perfectly run hotel. No complaints about anything. Also stayed at the Loews in Quebec City and that too was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and clean but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: cbuie
Reviews.Content: I don't really get what all the fabulous reviews of this property are for. I certainly wouldn't hope it's the best Montreal has to offer. We stayed at the Loews for one night, originally it was to be for 2 nights but before we departed on our trip we had to cut one night off of Montreal, and I'm actually glad we didn't stay two nights here. First, a disclaimer- I'm a total hotel snob, I prefer the Four Seasons and Ritz properties, and am also a bit OCD about cleanliness, so I have pretty high standards. Don't get me wrong, our room was very clean (which says a lot coming from me) and comfortable, the front staff was cheerful, and the bathroom was actually the best part. All marble, with a wonderfully big tub. If I were in town on business, or even for a girls' trip, I would stay here again. However, I was traveling for a long-overdue vacation and time spent with my husband, and for that, this property is just adequate. It's not luxurious or romantic. This is a big, busy, bustling hotel right downtown. I prefer the elegance and calmness of a Four Seasons property (which doesn't exist in Montreal), or a small, boutique-type hotel, so this just wasn't a good fit for our purposes. The other thing is that this property is looking slightly worn. The red carpet in the halls is dated and tired-looking. Our bathroom wall had peeling paint. We had one of the executive suites, and at that price, there's just no excuse for any paint to be chipped off and peeling. I will say the hotel was very quiet though, which is a huge plus. I was rather nervous after reading some of the reviews complaining about noise. Our room was one of the back-street facing rooms, so we had no street noise and never heard our neighbors, so no thin walls here (compared to many hotels today), which was very nice and I got a good night's sleep. So while our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable, I just wanted to let people know that's it not luxurious or romantic if you're looking for that on vacation. Next time I'll be staying at the Hotel Le St. James!

Reviews.Title: “Glorious place to stay to spoil yourself”
Reviews.Author: SuzieVinny
Reviews.Content: From the doorman, to the front desk, to the bellman, to the houseman, to the room - WOW! - to the bathroom - double WOW! - to the room service, this hotel is a destination in itself. We had planned to go to a walking distance restaurant which was highly recommended, but decided to stay in because the room was so glorious - and it was raining! I travel with pets and was offered pet-sitting services by the front desk if we had decided to go out for dinner. We ordered room service expecting an adequate meal and were very pleased. While this hotel was outside our usual price range, we were happy we decided to splurge and stay there as well as stay in and order room service!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room!”
Reviews.Author: Newtonteacher
Reviews.Content: If I didn't want to see Montreal, I would have been happy to stay in the room. The bed was amazing with soft sheets and duvet and a great mattress. The bathroom was huge and lovely. The hotel was located well, too. My only complaint was the price of parking (we never moved the car yet the rates were incredibly high). Also, check out rate deals. We had a buy 2 nights, get the 3rd free but when we noticed the prices dropped even more, they gave us a price adjustment.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: traveltoes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Vogue for 6 days with 2 friends. We had a lovely suite that was 2 adjoining rooms. Fabulous bathrooms. Rooms were quiet and the beds very comfortable. The concierge was very helpful- even got me a fantastic hockey ticket. Location was great, just off of St Catherines, although I like the St Denis area for it's interesting shops. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is perfectly located in the...”
Reviews.Author: Donie95
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the downtown area convenient to all areas. The staff was super helpful with recommendations for things to do and places to eat. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A top notch hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: norskara
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Vogue. It was a last minute change. We had booked another cheaper hotel and then got nervous that it wouldn't be very nice. The Loews gave us a very fair rate and were perfectly located in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: afian
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I went to Montreal for a mother/daugher get away. The Loew's Vogue hotel was recommended by our travel agent. We certainly were not disappointed. The property is very comfortable and the service was excellent. The doorman was always available and willing to assist with directions, recommendations, and was an adjunct to the concierge. We were warmly greeted at check in and our contact with the front desk was always very responsive. I am very selective about the hotels I stay in and this one is marked as one for several repeats. Beside the comfort factor, it is well located. We loved Montreal and we look forward to our return to the Loew's Vogue. If you select this hotel you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Edradour
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Loew's Hotel Vogue in Centre-Ville while attending meetings on nearby rue Drummond. My stay was excellent - from the clean and beautiful room to the en-suite jacuzzi to room service to all of the staff I encountered. The personal service really is nice. When I checked in, my key accidentally not activated correctly. After seeing me struggling at the room door, a maintenance man let me in. I told him not to worry about getting me a new key as I was headed out in minutes and would simply stop at the desk. A few moments later, he's back at my door anyway with a new key and apologies by name. The doormen know your name as do the front desk staff. The people are just very nice and seem very proud to work at Loews. A great stay! K

Reviews.Title: “Quiet room, unbelieveably comfortable bed, luxurious bathroom”
Reviews.Author: LizTem
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by this hotel in every way. The room was spacious, well appointed and well equipped. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in, so much so that on returning home our much loved own bed seems somewhat lacking. A cot had been requested and was ready in the room when we arrived. Our room faced the main street (Rue de la Montagne) but despite this the room was still quiet and the blackout curtains shut out any light from the street. The bathroom was luxurious, all marble with a huge shower, jacuzzi bath and more towels than you could possibly need! Service was excellent. Staff were friendly and helpfull and were happy to swap between English and French. We felt that every effort had been made to make our stay comfortable. Our only complaints would be that twice our complimentary coffee and tea was not refilled, however, on reporting this to reception, it was soon rectified. Also the cost of room service was extortionate beyond belief with charges such as $6 (Â£4) for a glass of orange juiceand $12 (Â£8) for a slice of chocolate cake and these were the cheaper options. Whist we appreciate that you do pay slightly more for room service, it is hard to believe that the food would have been worth these amounts, and we would have used the service had the prices been more reasonable. For people travelling with an infant (like us) it is hard to go out in the evening to a restaurant so a reasonably priced room service would have been appreciated. All in all we had a lovely stay in Montreal and the standard of the hotel was a definite plus point of our holiday. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly fantastic- Great Location- Great Rooms- Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ispoono
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in December 2009 just before christmas and was amazed how nice this hotel was! Room was very large and bed was enormous, 4 poster, so comfortable! Bathroom was simply out of this world. Huge Whirlpool bath, large separate shower, LCD satellite TV, Marble finish, very very impressive! Bar Lobby area was also very nice and they serve one of the finest cognac's money can buy (albeit at a price!) Overall amazed by the quality of the rooms, the efficiency and friendlyness of the staff, and without doubt the price! Very impressed, one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. When I next visit Montreal, I wont be staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: West_London_Couple75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4-days and absolutely loved every minute of it. We lived in luxury at a bargain. We had a jacuzzi bath and TV in our bathroom, the room was decorated beautifully, and we never heard any noise from the other rooms. The staff members were always friendly and accommodating. Loved Montreal in general. Definitely the best Canadian city we have ever been to yet.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, spacious rooms in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jms71424
Reviews.Content: The bed was the most comfortable Iâ€™ve ever experienced at a hotel. The bathroom was also very spacious with a whirlpool tub, shower and a separate vanity. Great locastion a block from lots of restaurants to choose fromâ€¦burger joints, pubs, supper clubs, upscale French and Italian. The metro stop peel was also only a few blocks away. I would definitely want to stay here again. There was nothing not to like. The concierge was very helpful with recommending restaurants and places to go for live music. Everyone who worked there was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel, nice employees, comfortable and big”
Reviews.Author: Maria35
Reviews.Content: pros--great staff, really good concierge (use them!), room very comfortable, quiet and big. TV has the golf channel. good coffee in room cons--the $15 charge for wi-fi in the room---come on Holiday Inn gives it to you free will be back

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel--they saved me”
Reviews.Author: smblue1
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed for 3 nights. Good location, great room, excellent service. Best Hotel bed I have ever slept in!!!!!!!!!!!! I have travelled a lot, and did the dumbest thing I have ever done. I left personal checks written to me, and $450 in cash and my iphone in the safe. I also left a few items of clothes in the room. We were driving to Quebec City when I realized, so we called the Hotel-Vogue to tell them what happened. They said they would check on it and call us back. 25 min later they called and said they found everything. they sent it Fed-Ex to the Hotel we were in in Quebec City and it came the next day. I just have to say big thanks to Lowes Hotel Vogue for being so responsive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel - location, spotless, friendly, great concierge, internet”
Reviews.Author: krbaker
Reviews.Content: Best city hotel we've ever stayed in. This hotel had everything that was important to us. The location was good. Our room was immaculate, the bathroom was quite large with lots of towels. The beds were wonderful. We didn't have to touch the climate control in our room the entire stay and the air conditioning was very quiet. Their concierge staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They made our dinner reservations every night and were available all day and evening with suggestions as to where to go and what to do. The hotel had free easily accessible internet in the lobby. They had the fastest elevators on the planet. The nightly rate was a good value too. It all added up to one great hotel experience and helped make our vacation to Montreal very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, beware of the noise on weekends”
Reviews.Author: BigBree
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, but do not stay in a room facing the front (De La Montagne Street) on the weekend. Having requested a quiet room, we were unable to sleep until 4AM because of drunk revelers on the patio below. The desk clerk obliged us with a quieter room the following day, but acknowledged that noise can be a problem since the building was originally an office building and was not adequately insulated against noise. Aside from this issue, the rooms are very well equipped, and the large marble bathrooms are fabulous. The four poster queen bed makes for a romantic experience, as does the large jacuzzi tub. There is a Keurig coffee machine in the room, so there is decent coffee. Internet is free in the lobby, but $15 in the rooms, an unnecessary add on in these days of wi-fi. Local phone calls are also overcharged for ($1 per call). The hotel is located on the heart of Montreal, with easy access to the metro and a 30 min walk to Old Montreal and the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Amerzzz1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to have a romantic weekend getaway for our anniversary this past weekend. After looking into multiple hotels we finally decided on the Loews Vogue since we had heard great things. We took advantage of the Scandinavian Baths package that the hotel offered which included a room service "Banana Split" breakfast plus several other ammenities. Things were just perfect! The hotel staff was extremely accomidating. Thom, the consierge we so helpful, first in picking the most perfect restaurant for our anniversary dinner (Europea) and helping my boyfriend send me a surprise bottle of champagne! (The card from the hotel was extra sweet). The staff was amazing, overly friendly and super helpful with everything. Even calling us to make sure everything was in the room, and when it wasn't it was sent up within 10 minutes. Room service was speedy and delicious. Would have liked to not have paid 15 a day for internet access though. Would 100% stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JOHNSED
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown Montreal - close to McGill, Concordia and to Golden Mile restaurants and bars. Friendly service (although a bit slow one day making up the room). Reasonably priced, beautiful rooms. Sorry to see $15 per day charge for internet - this should be free at this class of hotel

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tenniseyeguy
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Loews. We found the rooms to be spacious and the bathrooms were large and luxurious. The location was excellent as well. However, the restaurant was expensive and you would do well to get breakfast (we loved eggspectation) and other places in this city. I would recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but could use some tender loving care”
Reviews.Author: SpaGirl007
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Loews for a girlfriend getaway vacation. I read the reviews and was very excited about the hotel. Unfortunately, it did not live up to my expectations. The positives are the hotel is in a great location and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The cons are the hotel needs a makeover and to pay more attention to detail. The first room we stayed in looked like an 18 wheeler ground dirt into the carpet...yuck! I asked for another room and the staff quickly moved us to another that was much better. However, this room had a cobweb as big as my head and hair in the shower (not mine). I expect MUCH more from a "luxury" hotel. The cleaning staff eventually took care of the issues but did nothing more to accommodate us. I've stayed at lesser hotels that have gone above and beyond, which they did not do. Overall an OK hotel in a good location. If I return to Montreal this would not be a hotel of my choice. I would stay in Old Montreal at a hotel that pays more attention to details (cleanliness and service).

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ingridH11
Reviews.Content: Great location and great service, the rooms are nice with great bathrooms with bath and separate shower and nice toiletries. The only negative remark I have is the stained carpet in the room. Housekeeping is great and honest, I had forgotten a pearl necklace in the bathroom which was returned to me after my return to the states Was one of the most quiet hotels ever, no sound at all assured for a great night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, the Loews is close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: mikesmyth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Loews Vogue with friends for a long weekend and really enjoyed it. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the beds were incredible. The bathroom was huge and had a nice shower with large separate whirlpool bath. The room comes with a nice coffee machine and various coffee "pods" and disposable cups so we could take coffee on-the-go in the morning. There's a business center with several computers for guests behind the concierge desk in the lobby. My favorite part about the hotel though is the location. It's about a half block from St. Catherine and only a block over from Crescent St. so you feel like you're right in the middle of everything. The charge for valet parking was a little steep (I think 45 CAD per night?) so I parked in a garage around the corner and only paid $45 CAD for a 3-night weekend. Also, there's a roof top pool and bar at the hotel across the street (Hotel Montagne?) that was convenient and fun for during the day. Overall, I'd give the Loews Vogue two thumbs up and plan to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, needs attention to details!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCToronto
Reviews.Content: The physical hotel is indeed lovely. The in room glasses were spotless (something not always the case), the computers in the lobby were always available, location was very central with plenty of wonderful restaurants close by. The staff were helpful and pleasant. The door men were a wealth of information. The room temperature was easily controlled, the bathroom was lush and the bed and linens - divine! However, the halls are so cold you sprint through them to get to your room quickly. The complimentary in room coffee/tea center was not replenished and even after we requested supplies the supplies were not complete. We had a street facing room that was so noisy we were woken several times with shouting and such. They need to install sound proof windows! The steam iron in the room leaked all over the skirt I was trying to quickly press to make a dinner reservation and when I called down to complain they kindly offered to iron it for me at once. When it was brought back up it was still wet and there was a bill attached for $10.00... hardly what I was expecting. All in all it was a grand hotel in a fab location with a need for more attention to details and a definition of 'going the extra mile'.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not a "wow" unless maybe on a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: 60763Lisa
Reviews.Content: I took my college age daughter here (just the 2 of us). The hotel was very clean (although the rug had quite a few stains on it) Very good location and very safe (need room card to go up in the elevator). If you want a very large bathroom with a tv in it, you will certainly find it here. Personally, I did not see the need for it. The lobby was very small - not much there. - I was expecting a "fun" atmosphere in this hotel because it is supposed to be kid friendly but it was really quite reserved. The concierge Thom was great - highly recommend using him. They were all helpful but Thom was excellent. I think the hotel needs an additional concierge in the daytime - they seemed understaffed. The doorman was very helpful and would make a great concierge! Be careful - I was told I could use a $50 credit for room internet service but they charged me for it anyway. The manager agreed to take the charges off after speaking with her. I was not able to hear noise from the streets as people said (although I was in the back of the hotel) but I constantly heard doors in the hotel opening and closing during the night. Overall, good but nothing spectacular as I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Weekend at the Vogue”
Reviews.Author: Peterandliz
Reviews.Content: We researched, checked Tripadvisor and other travel sites, made and cancelled two other reservations and finally settled on the Vogue. Truly enjoyed our stay there, received free upgrade, bottle of champagne and all was well. The room clean and quiet, bed very comfortable and bathroom was a dream. Jacuzzi, TV and plenty of space. Initially we wanted to stay in old Montreal but were pleased with this location and actually liked it better that the hub bub of old Montreal. Martinis at the bar/restaurant in the lobby were excellent, expensive but excellent. Would highly recommend this hotel when visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for just about any type of traveler”
Reviews.Author: mollybecky
Reviews.Content: A top notch facility with large, quiet rooms and a very comfortable atmosphere. It's hard to believe that you are in the middle of Montreal (and especially St. Catherine's Street). This is my daughter's favorite hotel and city in Canada--and my favorite Canadian hotel and city as well!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MSBLACKDRESS
Reviews.Content: Hotel and hotel staff was impeccable. We booked this hotel once we arrived in Montreal. We parked across the street from it and called the 800 number and reservation was quick and friendly. Once we entered the hotel, the staff could not be more helpful. And the room. Beautiful canopy bed. I am very picky when it comes to the bathroom. And it was beautiful and superclean. The whirlpool tub was fabulous. Loved the fact that on our check out date, the hotel porter was very friendly and helpful when we asked where we can find breakfast on the go. He gave us great advice and held our car, loaded our baggage in front of the hotel with no issues at all. I will definetly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LDV15
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed the hotel in November 2009 and loved the location and the large washroom! We were upgraded to Queen Canopy room and loved every part of it! The room was cozy and the staff was very nice. We let them know that we were here for a special occasion and they were kind enough to provide us with a little something for our trip. The hotel is very to close all tourist attractions. We were actually able to walk to the hotel from our train station! Great hotel, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean room”
Reviews.Author: DiscoD27
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in the heart of downtown Montreal...look no further. This hotel is right beside St. Catherine and a 2 minute walk to Crescent. Despite being so close to everything, we were not affected by the noise at all. Overall a nice experience and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: PurpleObsession
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late as I am just getting into the whole tripadvisor experience throught planning a trip to Punta Cana!!! Loews Hotel Vogue located in the heart of Downtown Montreal is just amazing, the hotel couldn't be in a better location. My boyfriend and I went to Montreal for a weekend getaway and wanted to stay somewhere extremly nice and this did not dissapoint. Upon arrival the room we requested was not available, we were quickly assigned a suite for our first night wich was both huge and amazing, we were also given a complimentary cheese tray for their mistake, the next night we got the room we had requested and again were not dissapointed. The room was spacious and the bathroom was to die for with a double whirlpool tub to boot. The huge bed was very comfortable and we had no complaints!!!! We ordered room service every night, it was delish and the service was always fast. The doormen were extremly nice and the whole experience was great for us. We will be returning to this hotel in the future and would reccomend it to anyone looking for a total hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Near Perfect Hotel with Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: WatsonTravellers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vogue had a great location central to all the downtown shopping, restaurants, hockey stadium, etc. My husband and I even walked to the Old Port area in under an hour. The free internet in the lobby was a great feature when researching sights and menus. The room was more than comfortable Ipod dock and Keurig machine included! We had an extremely spacious king, non-smoking overlooking the street. The street for the most part was very quiet and only on the first night did we hear loud voices passing by. The bed was amazingly comfortable - the only real knock on the entire stay was the bedding. We had a non-smoking room which even had a sign in it mentioning if you do smoke you'd be fined $100. Well, the bed linens were a bit smokey. Every morning my hair smelled like smoke and if you snuggled into a pillow or linen you could smell smoke. I thought maybe I'd picked it up out and about in the city, but after three nights I'm quite sure it was the bed. Only complaint and I would have mentioned it to the front desk had we a longer stay and I figured it out sooner. Onto the bathroom. The most thoughtful hotel bath I've seen. It was huge, complete with tv, phone, makeup mirror and good hairdryer. It was very spacious with a large tub and seperate shower. The best part was outside of the bath was a large vanity and stool complete with a second hairdryer and hollywood lighting. I was in heaven. We did not dine on site but had drinks in the lobby bar one night. It was OK. Drinks were nothing too exciting but the barman seemed more intrigued to talk to the other women at the bar because he never even asked my husband what he wanted to drink! Just assumed he wanted what I did. Well, the next two nights we had cocktails at the restaurant bar. Much better! The first night we were there late 12PM to 1:30 AM. After the last patrons left for dinner, they turned up some fun music and the gorgeous bartender generously kept the wine flowing - which was a feat in a city that seems to have some strict liquor laws. It was a very fun atmosphere. The second night we were there for a pre-dinner drink and were treated to some amuse bouche to nibble on. Go to this bar! Also, the conceirge was awesome. We worked with an extremely well-groomed young man who gave us two great recommendations. When I gave him some feedback he seemed very appreciative. (Vargus and Europea, if you're wondering). Two thumbs up for him! (Wish I knew his name, but my husband worked with him). We considered a few other properties for our romantic weekend - Le Crystal, W, and Hotel Nelligan. We are big into checking out other properties so we had drinks at Le Crystal and Nelligan to compare. (We couldn't find the W)! Le Crystal staff seemed a bit snobby but had a small chic bar, with inconsistant service and drink quality (we stayed for two.) The Nelligan seemed alright if you needed to be in the Old Port area but the lobby and bar/restaurant were very sterile and seemed like they could be in any Hilton type of place. We just loved The Vogue Hotel and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “unpretentious yet refined service”
Reviews.Author: casanaranja
Reviews.Content: right across from louis vuitton, this fab hotel is right in the middle of the action. with cozy double-down quilts, unpretentious yet refined service, in-suite fireplaces and bath goodies from lather, you might have to force yourself to get out and hit the town.
